column3: Not that it should be trusted verbatim (I guess?), but if any changes occur after a comment, then the changed commits will be moved _below_ the original comment.\n

@dcousens yes but without a reference to which commits were ACK'd it's impossible to tell what if anything was changed

for an example of this see #3154
Agree that this is useful in some cases, but as long as this is a manual step I don't really want to force it on everyone.\n
@laanwj sure thus, SHOULD instead of MUST\n
Ok, concept ACK, agree on the style nits.\n
ACK, after updating the commit message. It still mentions id rather than hash.\n
another great example of why this is necessary https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6451\n
And a dot at the end of the sentence.\n
I do not see any dot there Luke 8)\n
